iana.template_text:
(registered 2014-11-21, last updated 2014-11-21)

Name : Adam Retter

Email : adam.retter&googlemail.com

MIME media type name : Text

MIME subtype name : Standards Tree - csv-schema

Required parameters : None

Optional parameters : 
None

Encoding considerations : 8-bit. The CSV Schema language is expressed in UTF-8 text.

Security considerations : 
This is a human readable text based format that can also be interpreted by applications to validate CSV data. It does have directives for accessing files that are referenced by CSV files, however it is assumed that the security of such will be controlled by the parsing Application and ultimately the underlying Operating System. The format contains no executable content. The format provides no integrity or privacy protection, so if this is needed it must be supplied externally.

Interoperability considerations : 
None known. 

Published specification : 
Either:
http://digital-preservation.github.io/csv-validator/csv-schema-1.0.html
http://digital-preservation.github.io/csv-schema/csv-schema-1.0.html

Applications which use this media : 
https://github.com/digital-preservation/csv-validator

Fragment identifier considerations :
None applied for.

Restrictions on usage :
None known.

Provisional registration? (standards tree only) :


Additional information :

1. Deprecated alias names for this type : None 2. Magic number(s) : None 3. File extension(s) : .csvs 4. Macintosh file type code : None 5. Object Identifiers: None


Person to contact for further information :

1. Name : David Underdown
2. Email : DigitalPreservation&nationalarchives.gsi.gov.uk

Intended usage : Common
A public standard for CSV Schema as developed by The National Archives, UK.

Author/Change controller : The National Archives, UK
